content.value_statement: Users struggle to create consistent, platform-optimized social media content that drives engagement. This skill provides templates, strategies, and frameworks for creating posts across LinkedIn, Twitter/X, Instagram, TikTok, and Facebook.
actual_capabilities: Generate platform-specific post templates for LinkedIn, Twitter/X, Instagram, TikTok, and Facebook
Create content calendars and batching strategies for consistent posting
Develop effective hooks and CTAs based on proven engagement patterns
Repurpose long-form content (blogs, podcasts, videos) into social formats
Analyze and reverse-engineer viral content patterns in any niche
Provide platform-specific strategy tips based on algorithm preferences
limitations: Does not actually post or schedule content to social platforms
Cannot access real-time analytics or engagement data
Cannot scrape or fetch content from social platforms
Does not create visual assets (images, videos, graphics)

use_cases.title: Create a LinkedIn thought leadership post

use_cases.title: Build a weekly content calendar

use_cases.target_user: Marketing teams and solopreneurs managing multiple platforms

use_cases.title: Reverse engineer viral content in your niche

prompt_templates.title: Basic social media post request
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a [platform] post about [topic]. Target audience: [description]. Goal: [awareness/engagement/leads]. Tone: [professional/casual/witty]. Include a hook and CTA.
prompt_templates.scenario: Quick post generation with minimal context

prompt_templates.title: Full content brief
prompt_templates.prompt: I need help creating social content. Context: [brand description], [target audience], [current goals]. Create: [number] LinkedIn posts, [number] Twitter threads, and [number] Instagram captions for [timeframe]. Include content pillars and scheduling suggestions.

prompt_templates.title: Content repurposing
prompt_templates.prompt: I have a [blog post/podcast/video] about [topic]. Repurpose this into: 1) A LinkedIn carousel outline, 2) A Twitter thread (7 tweets), 3) An Instagram Reel script, 4) A TikTok short video concept.
prompt_templates.scenario: Turning long-form content into platform-specific pieces

prompt_templates.title: Viral pattern extraction

prompt_templates.scenario: Learning from top performers in a specific niche

output_examples.input: Create a Twitter thread about how to learn any new skill fast.

**Tweet 1:** I learned 3 programming languages, 2 musical instruments, and 4 design tools in under 2 years.

Here's the framework I used (it's not what you expect):

**Tweet 2:** Most people learn wrong.

They focus on consumption. Tutorials. Courses. Videos.

That's passive learning. It feels like progress. It's not.

**Tweet 3:** The secret: Project-based learning.

Pick a project on day 1. Build something real.

Google what you need as you go.

**Tweet 4:** Here's the exact 3-phase framework:

1. Build something immediately (even if broken)
2. Ship it and get feedback
3. Refine while learning the 'right' way

**Tweet 5:** This works because:
- You learn what you actually need
- You build a portfolio
- You stay motivated
- You remember more

**Tweet 6:** The best time to start was yesterday.

The second best time is right now.

Pick one thing you want to learn.

Build something this week.

**Tweet 7:** If this was helpful, follow me for more on learning and productivity.

best_practices: Always lead with a hook in the first line or first 3 seconds (this determines whether anyone reads the rest)
Adapt content to each platform's algorithm preferences and format constraints (e.g., no external links in LinkedIn posts)
Batch content creation in dedicated sessions (2-3 hours weekly) while leaving room for real-time engagement and trend responses
anti_patterns: Cross-posting identical content across platforms without adaptation (each platform has unique format and algorithm preferences)
Overly promotional content without providing value first (aim for 90% value, 10% promotion)
Scheduling everything with no real-time engagement (algorithms reward active participation in conversations)

faq.question: Does this skill actually post content to social media?
faq.answer: No, this skill generates content strategies, templates, and posts. You will need to copy the output to your social media scheduling tool or post directly.

faq.question: Can this skill access my social media analytics?
faq.answer: No, this skill cannot connect to social media APIs or access your account data. It provides frameworks and templates based on general best practices.

faq.question: Which platforms does this skill support?
faq.answer: The skill covers LinkedIn, Twitter/X, Instagram, TikTok, and Facebook with platform-specific strategies, formats, and algorithm tips for each.

faq.question: How do I create viral content?
faq.answer: The skill includes a reverse engineering framework that guides you to study top performers in your niche, extract proven patterns, and build your own template library.

faq.question: Can I use this for client work or agency purposes?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill is suitable for creating content strategies and drafts for clients, though you will need to adapt the output to each client's specific voice and brand.

faq.question: How often should I post on each platform?
faq.answer: Recommended posting frequency: LinkedIn 3-5x per week, Twitter/X 3-10x daily (including replies), Instagram 1-2 posts + 3-10 Stories daily, TikTok 1-4x daily, Facebook 1-2x daily.
